verses.verse: (Deut. 7:24) No man shall be able to stand before you all the days of your life; (Ex. 3:12) as I was with Moses, so (Deut. 31:8, 23) I will be with you. (Deut. 31:6, 7; Heb. 13:5) I will not leave you nor forsake you.
(Deut. 31:7, 23) Be strong and of good courage, for to this people you shall divide as an inheritance the land which I swore to their fathers to give them.

Only be strong and very courageous, that you may observe to do according to all the law (Num. 27:23; Deut. 31:7; Josh. 11:15) which Moses My servant commanded you; (Deut. 5:32) do not turn from it to the right hand or to the left, that you may prosper wherever you go.

(Deut. 17:18, 19; 31:24, 26; Josh. 8:34) This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but (Deut. 29:9; Ps. 1:1-3) you shall meditate in it day and night, that you may observe to do according to all that is written in it. For then you will make your way prosperous, and then you will have good success.
(Deut. 31:7) Have I not commanded you? Be strong and of good courage; (Ps. 27:1) do not be afraid, nor be dismayed, for the LORD your God is with you wherever you go.”
(The Order to Cross the Jordan) Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,

“Pass through the camp and command the people, saying, ‘Prepare provisions for yourselves, for (Deut. 9:1; Josh. 3:17) within three days you will cross over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land which the LORD your God is giving you to possess.’ ”
And to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and half the tribe of Manasseh Joshua spoke, saying,
“Remember (Num. 32:20-28) the word which Moses the servant of the LORD commanded you, saying, ‘The LORD your God is giving you rest and is giving you this land.’

Your wives, your little ones, and your livestock shall remain in the land which Moses gave you on this side of the Jordan. But you shall pass before your brethren armed, all your mighty men of valor, and help them,

until the LORD has given your brethren rest, as He gave you, and they also have taken possession of the land which the LORD your God is giving them. (Josh. 22:1-4) Then you shall return to the land of your possession and enjoy it, which Moses the LORD’s servant gave you on this side of the Jordan toward the sunrise.”
So they answered Joshua, saying, “All that you command us we will do, and wherever you send us we will go.
Just as we heeded Moses in all things, so we will heed you. Only the LORD your God (1 Sam. 20:13; 1 Kin. 1:37) be with you, as He was with Moses.
Whoever rebels against your command and does not heed your words, in all that you command him, shall be put to death. Only be strong and of good courage.”

(Rahab Hides the Spies) Now Joshua the son of Nun sent out two men (Num. 25:1; Josh. 3:1) from Acacia Grove to spy secretly, saying, “Go, view the land, especially Jericho.” So they went, and (Heb. 11:31; James 2:25) came to the house of a harlot named (Matt. 1:5) Rahab, and lodged there.
And (Josh. 2:22) it was told the king of Jericho, saying, “Behold, men have come here tonight from the children of Israel to search out the country.”
So the king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, “Bring out the men who have come to you, who have entered your house, for they have come to search out all the country.”
(2 Sam. 17:19, 20) Then the woman took the two men and hid them. So she said, “Yes, the men came to me, but I did not know where they were from.
And it happened as the gate was being shut, when it was dark, that the men went out. Where the men went I do not know; pursue them quickly, for you may overtake them.”
(But (Ex. 1:17; 2 Sam. 17:19) she had brought them up to the roof and hidden them with the stalks of flax, which she had laid in order on the roof.)
Then the men pursued them by the road to the Jordan, to the fords. And as soon as those who pursued them had gone out, they shut the gate.
Now before they lay down, she came up to them on the roof,

and said to the men: (Deut. 1:8) “I know that the LORD has given you the land, that (Gen. 35:5; Ex. 23:27; Deut. 2:25; 11:25; Josh. 9:9, 10) the terror of you has fallen on us, and that all the inhabitants of the land (Ex. 15:15; Josh. 5:1) are fainthearted because of you.

For we have heard how the LORD (Ex. 14:21; Josh. 4:23) dried up the water of the Red Sea for you when you came out of Egypt, and (Num. 21:21-35) what you did to the two kings of the Amorites who were on the other side of the Jordan, Sihon and Og, whom you (Deut. 20:17; Josh. 6:21) utterly destroyed.
